articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli jets and artillery hit multiple targets in southern Lebanon overnight, Israel's military said on Thursday, amid spiralling tensions following the mass attack on Hezbollah communications devices this week.
articles.title: Israeli strikes hit multiple targets in Lebanon

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik
articles.description: European customers have been transferring Indian munitions to Ukraine and, despite Russian protests, India sees arms exports as a commercial opportunity.
articles.title: Exclusive: Ammunition from India enters Ukraine, raising Russian ire

articles.author: Barbara Erling
articles.description: The army said 16,000 soldiers were helping out in the region, alongside police and thousands of volunteers.
articles.title: Poland's third-largest city braces for peaking floods

articles.author: Marc Leras
articles.description: One of more than 50 men accused of raping Frenchwoman Gisele Pelicot in a mass rape case that has shocked the world told her in court on Thursday that he was sorry for what he did.
articles.title: Accused in France's mass rape trial apologises to Gisele Pelicot

articles.author: Karen Lema, Poppy Mcpherson
articles.description: The Typhon system, which can be equipped with cruise missiles capable of striking Chinese targets, was brought in for joint exercises earlier this year.
articles.title: Exclusive: US keeps missile system in Philippines as China tensions rise, tests wartime deployment

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel's Mossad spy agency planted a small amount of explosives inside 5,000 Taiwan-made pagers ordered by Lebanese group Hezbollah months before Tuesday's detonations, a senior Lebanese security source and another source told Reuters.
articles.title: Israel planted explosives in Hezbollah's Taiwan-made pagers, say sources

articles.author: Sudipto Ganguly, Uditha Jayasinghe
articles.description: The outcome is expected to determine the fate of a fragile economic recovery led by incumbent Ranil Wickremesinghe.
articles.title: With eyes on economy, Sri Lankans to vote for president in tight election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A child enrolled in a Japanese school in Shenzhen, China, has died after being stabbed by an assailant on Wednesday, the Japanese government said.
articles.title: 10-year-old student at Japanese school in China dies after stabbing

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris will join celebrity billionaire Oprah Winfrey for an online event with grassroots groups on Thursday to rally support in battleground states.
articles.title: Kamala Harris, Oprah Winfrey to hold virtual event aimed at battleground states

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China said on Thursday its Liaoning aircraft carrier had been on a routine training mission in the western Pacific and dismissed charges by Tokyo that the vessel and its escorts had entered Japanese waters.
articles.title: China says carrier accused of entering Japanese waters was on routine training
